intro: Hieracium applicans, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are often lobed or divided. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium applicans is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along roadsides, and it can sometimes be invasive in certain regions.
